content.subject: CSS Layout News - Issue 254
content.body:
CSS Layout News
Issue 254 - 9th June 2020

Read this issue on the web
https://csslayout.news/issues/254?sid=4V3JKLk


### News

Issue 254

Over the next two weeks I have a whole bunch of online things taking place. Later today, if you are quick you can sign up for the free of charge [Smashing Meets event](https://cur.at/Y3g6Z5h?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk). I'll be speaking on the Evolution of Responsive Design. Then on Thursday and Friday I will be running my [CSS Layout Masterclass](https://cur.at/2v9kphr?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk) - there are a few tickets left if you would like to join me.

Next week I will be speaking at the very first [An Event Apart Online Together](https://cur.at/HSyvSUk?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk), your chance to hear a talk I won't be doing anything like as many times I thought I would this year! An Event Apart are the sponsor of the newsletter this week, in addition to the event next week, they are running a second event dedicated to Human-centered design. Take a look at the details in the footer of this email.
Rachel Andrew, CSS Layout News

### Learn

Web Platform Contribution Guide
https://cur.at/we87okW?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
This is great. A guide to contributing to the web platform.

Quick Tips for High Contrast Mode | Sarah Higley
https://cur.at/7XSW3EZ?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
A post with a round-up of tips and resources for learning about Windows High Contrast Mode.

Equivalent Experiences: Thinking Equivalently â Smashing Magazine
https://cur.at/bvgRz6t?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
In this article Eric discusses learning how to embrace an equivalent, inclusive mindset. Providing practical, robust ways to improve your websites and web apps by providing solutions to common, everyday barriers.

A userâs guide to CSS variables â Increment: Frontend
https://cur.at/iPMpGra?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
An excellent guide to CSS custom properties.

On fixed elements and backgrounds
https://cur.at/UxvnC6m?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
A really good rundown on fixed positioning, containing blocks and other related things from Chen Hui Jing.

### Interesting

The Mad Magazine Fold-In Effect in CSS | Thomas Park
https://cur.at/MRcAWkY?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
This is a fun technique, using CSS transforms.

### Our Sponsor

Human-Centered Design: Learn how to handle unexpected design scenarios and unusual situations.
https://cur.at/xLYH52p?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk
Join us Monday, July 20 for [An Event Apart: Online Together](https://cur.at/Sy0FbF5?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk), a single-day online web design conference focused on human-centered designâall the ways our work can impact users in personal ways, even when we donât intend to be so personal.

Youâll hear from:

- **Margot Bloomstein**, I Brake For Users: Content Strategy for Slower Experiences
- **Ron Bronson**, The Researcherâs Role in Reducing Consequence Design
- **Scott Jehl**, Performance is Accessibility
- **Jeremy Keith**, Design Principles for the Web
- **Morten Rand-Hendriksen**, Practical Ethics for the Modern Web Designer
- **Aarron Walter**, Designing for Emotion Revisited

All sessions will remain available to attendees, on-demand, for at least six months after the event is over, including the recordings of live Q&A sessions with the speakers. As we always aim for with our events, youâll come away not only inspired, but ready to put new techniques and ideas immediately into practice.

[See the full agenda and register now](https://cur.at/Sy0FbF5?m=email&sid=4V3JKLk).

Spike Island 133 Cumberland Rd Bristol BS1 6UX

CSS Layout News 2020 | [Privacy Policy](https://csslayout.news/privacy?sid=4V3JKLk) | Curated by [Rachel Andrew](https://rachelandrew.co.uk).

Unsubscribe from CSS Layout News
